intro: Sida tropica, commonly known as tropical sida, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to lanceolate in shape. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Sida tropica is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its use in traditional medicine in some regions.
